summary: The 'Protecting American Diplomats Act' (H.R. 4297) mandates a report from the Secretary of State to the House Foreign Affairs Committee and the Senate Foreign Relations Committee. This report, due within 120 days of the Act's enactment, will evaluate the quality and adequacy of counterintelligence (CI) training given to State Department personnel at high-risk diplomatic posts.  The report's contents include specifics on training content, tailoring to threat environments, personnel eligibility, interagency coordination, CI preparedness gaps, and recommendations. The report is to be unclassified but may include a classified annex, with the requirements expiring two years after enactment.
